intro: Catamixis, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Catamixis fragrans, which is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Catamixis is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
